oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee postcard by Aaron Camp
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color drawing by Aaron Camp of a silhouette of W.C. Handy performing on stage with a trumpet. He stands in front of a colorful backdrop, and the phrase "W.C. Handy, Father of Blues" is written in wavy letters towards the top of the postcard. This postcard is part of the Tennessee Bicentennial Mall State Park 1st Edition Children's Art Series. Features a divided back, narrative, and a semi-transparent logo for the state park on reverse. [No. 327610]
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Drawings; Musicians
